cluster_relations.rel_desc: The information about the contents of a black hole is encoded on the event horizon.
cluster_relations.subject_entity_name: information about the contents of a black hole

qualifiers.ConditionExpression: all the information about the contents

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The holographic principle asserts that the event horizon serves as the encoding surface for black hole information.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Interpretation: event horizon as 2D encoding of 3D bulk

remarks: Relation represents the principle’s prescription of where information resides.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that informational content about a physical system is encoded on a specified boundary or surface.
args.justification: This relation connects the informational content of a black hole to the event horizon as the surface where that information is encoded; the direction is from information to its encoding surface, so a predicate emphasizing information being encoded on a surface is appropriate.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a theoretical principle or framework designates a particular boundary or surface as the locus where information about a system is encoded.
args.justification: This relation connects the holographic principle (a theoretical framework) to the event horizon as the surface it designates for encoding information, which is conceptually different from a specific piece of information being encoded there; the predicate should capture the act of designation by the principle.
args.remark: Kept separate from direct information–surface encoding predicates to distinguish a theory's prescription from an instance of information being encoded.

args.justification: Both relations concern where information about a physical system is encoded (on the event horizon), either as a factual encoding relation or as a theoretical designation of that encoding surface, so they belong to the same broader class of information–location/encoding relations.
In both cases the core semantics are about the spatial/boundary location of information encoding (on the event horizon), fitting a broad spatial or locational grouping.
args.remark: A future refinement could introduce a more specialized high-level group such as REPRESENTATION if the ontology distinguishes it, but SPATIALITY is the closest standard broad group.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that informational content about a physical system is encoded on a specified boundary or surface.
executed_decisions.justification: This relation connects the informational content of a black hole to the event horizon as the surface where that information is encoded; the direction is from information to its encoding surface, so a predicate emphasizing information being encoded on a surface is appropriate.
